result.execSummary:
The defendant Edwin Raphael Fuentes-Pica was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:

Obtain/maintain employment;
Obtain GED or HSED
48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence

NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent;
NO contact with firearms

timeConds.notes:
07-15-2016/ Judge Michelle Havas
The defendant is non-compliant with the conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 30 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time in the HOC. 


STAYED pending a review on 07-15-2016 at 1:30 pm in Branch 45

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edwin Raphael Fuentes-Pica

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: reflects 07-15-16 Court order imposing 30 days of condition time

Defendant Edwin Raphael Fuentes-Pica not in court.  Joshua Anthony Dryak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
 Defendant is currently in absconder status.  Court ordered defendant to serve 30 days of the condition time; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 1 DISMISSED but read-in for sentencing purposes.  

As to Count 2 as Amended:    Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and the defendant.

As to Count 2 as Amended:  The court sentenced the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 2 days time served. 
The court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation with the WI Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Serve 30 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 7-15-2016 at 1:30 pm in Branch 45.
- Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention and continued programming.
- Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
- Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
- NO CONTACT with the victim, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent.
- 3rd party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren) as approved by agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Obtain GED or HSED.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
- Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
- 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.

Defendant Edwin Raphael Fuentes-Pica in court with attorney Angele R. Dentice.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record.  State has turned over offer and discovery.  Defense requests a scheduling conference date.  All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

16RM008298  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02/11/2016

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Lisbeth E. and Fania C.

Defendant Edwin Raphael Fuentes-Pica in court with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Defendant Edwin Raphael Fuentes-Pica in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Sworn as interpreter: Brenda Bartholomew  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 24, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
